item.title: 50,000 IU Vitamin D once every 2 weeks – response was 34 ng – RCT
item.description:
• Vitamin D Dosing Strategies Among Jordanians With Hypovitaminosis D

Vitamin D Dosing Strategies Among Jordanians With Hypovitaminosis D

J Pharm Pract. 2017 Apr;30(2):172-179. doi: 10.1177/0897190015626334

Nahla Khawaja 1, Mohammed Liswi 1, Mohammed El-Khateeb 1 2, Dana Hyassat 1, Dalila Bajawi 1, Mayada Elmohtaseb 1, Hussein Alkhateeb 1, Kamel Ajlouni 1

Objective: To compare between weekly and daily cholecalciferol in patients with hypovitaminosis D and to determine the optimal maintenance dose.

Methods: Seventy-one volunteers with hypovitaminosis D were randomly assigned to 2 dose regimens: cholecalciferol 50 000 IU weekly for 8 weeks, then 50 000 IU monthly for 2 months (group A ) and 7000 IU daily for 8 weeks, then 12 500 IU weekly for 2 months (group B ). Cholecalciferol was stopped for 2 months and reintroduced as 50 000 IU bimonthly for group A and 50 000 IU monthly for group B.

item.title: US RDA Vitamin D math mistakes cost the world about one Trillion dollars annually
item.description:
The US Institute of Medicine made 4 Vitamin D math mistakes in 2010

The IoM finally agreed that they made math mistakes in 2017

Instead of RDA = 600 IU, it should have been 8,800 IU (14X higher)

However, an IoM panel did not want to be embarrassed by publicly admitting mistakes.

The world copied the US mistake of 600 IU

$1 trillion math

  • Global health spending for 2018 = $8.3 trillion
